profile.name: Stephen J. Gray
profile.excerpt: Specialising in Frontend Development within a global leader in cyber security.
profile.objective: A confident senior software engineer working in a challenging and inspiring position within a global leader in cyber security organisation. A passionate agile practitioner, flexible, solution orientated, creative problem solver with a strong track record of success in large client-facing codebases.
technicalSkills: App Deployment and Server Provision within an SDDC Environment
personalAttributes: Analytical, problem solver who embraces challenge.

description: Working within the sector leading information security service as a front-end specialist involved in building a client-facing platform which provides clients with a clear and informed view of their security posture.
The role includes: working with geographically dispersed teams to develop secure MV* applications using HTML / CSS / JavaScript;
Presenting new features to stakeholders.
Participating in design and code reviews.
Mentoring new squad members on front-end technologies, app deployment, application and server set up.

Actively sought the squad app deployment specialist role, working with Linux servers and automated deployment tools; reducing the number of manual steps to deploy to fresh servers from 10 to one manual step.
Technologies utilized: JavaScript; BackboneJS; jQuery; LESS; HTML; JSP; Tiles; JSON; GIT and Subversion SVN.
A contract role developing a web based order management application using the ext.Net MVC framework. The role included:
Regular user testing, input and feedback;
Requirements gathering and analysis.
Ensuring an accurate and concise change log;
During this role I worked independently and managed my own schedule.
Technologies utilized: C#; SQL; JavaScript; CSS; HTML; Ajax; JSON; ext.Net and Tortoise SVN.
Creation of a web-based application utilising HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript to carry out value at risk calculations and display results using a variety of graphs.
Achieved through an agile software development approach, including significant client engagement and extensive testing.
Creating websites for small businesses, utilising wordpress, eCommerce platforms, php, HTML, CSS3 and Photoshop.
Conducting client liaison from pre-build to develop clear specification and contract to meet client needs, including marketing support and competitor analysis.
Delivery of sites to clients, including post-build maintenance aspects and training and support to enable client-led maintenance and updates.

Studies included: Database Principles and Applications; Principles and Practice of Programming; Foundations of Information Technology; Interface Design and the World Wide Web; Decision Support Systems; Multimedia; Object Orientated Software Design; and, Networking.
Winter Programming Assignment – achieved top mark in year group.
Dissertation - Value at Risk: Visual Approaches to Scrutinising Investment Risk- achieved grade of 1A.

Emerging Markets, Marketing Ethics, Retail Marketing, Social Marketing, Operations Management, Consumer Behaviour, Introduction to Scots Law, Human Resources Principles and Practice, German 1, Accounting for Business, Organisational Behaviour.

otherExperience.description:
Overseeing the operation of 89 place nursery, comprising a team of 22 staff members.
Increase in business performance from loss making position to over £11,500 monthly profit in six month period. Increase in full time equivalent occupancy by 18%.
Increase in service quality evidenced by positive parental feedback, positive feedback from local authority inspectors and grades achieved in setting during Care Inspection.

Overseeing the operation of 7 separate business units.
Review of marketing activities, leading to identification of opportunities to increase the visibility of the business.
Review of sites and subsequent coaching of management to implement improvements in performance related to parental involvement, self-evaluation and quality assurance systems, quality of environment, and staff deployment.
Providing leadership and support across multiple sites with varying business needs.

Responsible for the day to day running of 49 place private day care nursery comprising of 21 staff members and over 100 clients. Management of £350,000 annual budget.
Increase in operating capacity from 49 places to 59 childcare places; project manager in charge of securing permissions with regulator. Project manager in charge of scoping outline extensions and business diversification.
Regular input into Directors meetings, including performance measurement and reporting.
Responsible for the day to day running of 57 place private day care nursery comprising of 13 staff members.

otherExperience.company: Jack & Jill’s Private Day Care Nurseries.
otherExperience.description: Day to day responsibility for private day care nursery accommodating 64 children comprising of 10-12 staff members.
Management of 62 place premium private day care nursery comprising of 20 staff members.

otherExperience.company: Jack & Jill’s Private Day Care Nurseries.
otherExperience.description:
Ensuring the smooth running of 4 separate business units and up to 90 employees.
Running a management and leadership coaching programme for nursery management teams. Responsible for all internal and external marketing, business development and promotional activities. Involved in the set-up of 2 business units from initial premises selection, internal building works, approvals process to opening.
Managing localised advertising activities and press coverage gaining 119 new business enquiries over a 6 week period for a new business start-up.
Other Experience
